title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Gladly departing from Errol, after a stay whichour horses alone required or enjoyed, we proceeded through the well-wooded grounds of Mr. Allan,to the little vUlage of St. Madoes, where lay theHawk-stone, and whence we commanded a goodview of the town of Newburgh, and of the picturesque ruins of Lindores Abbey, in an orchard onthe opposite bank of the Tay.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: * Where the hawk is said to have alighted after its flight fromthe Hawk-stone, a similar mass of granite near St. Madoes,which determined the extent of land granted by Kenneth III.
